etymologies: late 16th century: modern Latin, perhaps from Latin capsa (see case)

definitions: a tropical American pepper plant of the nightshade family with fruits containing many seeds. Many cultivated varieties with edible, pungent fruits have been developed.

notes.text: Genus Capsicum, family Solanaceae: several species and varieties, in particular C. annuum variety annuum, the cultivated forms of which include the ‘grossum’ group (sweet peppers) and the ‘longum’ group (chili peppers)

shortDefinitions: tropical American plant of nightshade family with fruits peppers containing many seeds

definitions: the fruit of any of the capsicum plants, varying in size, color, and pungency.
shortDefinitions: fruit of any of capsicum plants, varying in size and pungency
